findings.message: To guarantee arguments type safety it is recommended to use `abi.encodeCall` instead of `abi.encodeWithSelector`.
findings.name: use-abi-encodecall-instead-of-encodewithselector

findings.message: <x> += <y> costs more gas than <x> = <x> + <y> for state variables.
findings.name: inefficient-state-variable-increment

findings.message: Uninitialized variables are assigned with the types default value. Explicitly initializing a variable with its default value costs unnecessary gas.
findings.name: init-variables-with-default-value

findings.message: Using multiple require statements is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.
findings.name: use-multiple-require

findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.
findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
